title: Is every philosophy a speculation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on what you mean by “speculation.” If you mean “a view that is not conclusively established by all available evidence,” then almost by definition all philosophy is speculation—that’s precisely when we need philosophy, when our evidence is inconclusive! But if you mean “wild-eyed guessing,” then philosophy is not speculation. Instead, it is clear-eyed argument and reasoning from facts and beliefs well-supported by evidence.

Yes .Because the truth is beyond the comprehension of the brain we are equipped with . It’s like 9 blind men touching different parts of the elephant and trying to categorically explain to others how elephant looks like . So philosophy is speculation.
